content.title: Fruit Processing Centre
content.details: The scheme 'Fruit Processing Centre' was launched by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya to disseminate technical knowhow to youth entrepreneurs, farmers, and housewives through the practical demonstration on the importance of fruit preservation and to manufacture quality processed fruit products such as Squashes, Jams, Jelly, canned fruits and Juices under the trade name ‘Meg Fruits Products’.
benefits: Awareness, Capacity building on fruit and vegetable processing
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Meghalaya.
The applicant should be a bonafide farmer engaged in agriculture.
content.application_process: The bonafide farmer can apply/write an application on plain paper. Along with the application, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Submit the duly filled and signed application along with the required documents at the nearest office of the Horticulture Development Officer of a CD Block/ Horticulture Circle. The bonafide farmers shall be selected on a first come first serve basis.

faqs.question: What is the key objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To disseminate technical knowhow to youth entrepreneurs, farmers, and housewives through practical demonstrations on the importance of fruit preservation. To manufacture quality processed fruit products such as Squashes, Jams, Jelly, canned fruits, and Juices under the trade name Meg Fruits products.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya

faqs.question: What is the type of assistance/service?
faqs.answer: Awareness, Capacity building on fruit and vegetable processing

faqs.question: What is the pattern of assistance?
Who can apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers engaged in agriculture are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers can apply in plain paper through the nearest Horticulture Development Officer of a CD Block/ Horticulture circle.

faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers shall be selected on a first come first serve basis.
